text.0: the guileless ones are singing praise to indras well beloved friend.
text.1: as in the morning of its life the mothers lick the newborn calf.
text.2: o indu while they cleanse thee bring o soma doublywaxing wealth.
text.3: thou in the worshippers abode causest all treasures to increase.
text.4: set free the song which mind hath yoked even as thunder frees the rain.
text.5: all treasures of the earth and heaven o soma thou dost multiply.
text.6: thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warriors steed.
text.7: hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.
text.8: flow on sage soma with thy stream to give us mental power and strength.
text.9: effused for indra for his drink for mitra and for varuṇa.
text.10: flow to the filter with thy stream effused best winner thou of spoil.
text.11: o soma as most rich in sweets for indra viṣṇu and the gods.
text.12: the mothers void of guiles caress thee goldencoloured in the sieve.
text.13: as cows o pavamana lick the newborn calf as law commands.
text.14: thou pavamana movest on with wondrous rays to great renown.
text.15: striving within the votarys house thou drivest all the glooms away.
text.16: lord of great sway thou liftest thee above the heavens above the earth.
text.17: thou pavamana hast assumed thy coat of mail in majesty.
